### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UGuC6wunr-I](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DUGuC6wunr-I) ### Comment Username: `@4n7hony` > Some social icons are not removed from the share popup. These icons appear only while logged in. I believe that the filter: > "youtube.com#?#yt-share-target-renderer > button.yt-share-target-renderer > yt-icon g[fill-rule].style-scope:upward(button.yt-share-target-renderer)" > is not removing those icons because the attribute [fill-rule] is located in 'circle' instead of 'g' for LiveJournal and it doesn't exist at all for Yahoo! Japan. > Could this filter be swapped with: "youtube.com##yt-share-target-renderer:not(:first-of-type)"? ### Screenshots

comment.body:
It seems that it's caused by `ABPindo` filter list, so please add this rule:
```adblock
samehadaku.run#@#a[rel*="nofollow"]
```
to user rules.

@gmarcher Could you please take a look?

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/144069#issuecomment-1454660851 

Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью юзерскрипта [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard Browser Extension, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить для Chrome, Edge или других браузеров на базе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установить для Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
